revised_title: Parasite Infection Affects Schooling Behavior in Minnows
tldr: The study investigates the effects of parasite infection with the cestode Ligula intestinalis on the schooling behavior of European minnows, Phoxinus phoxinus. Infected minnows exhibit increased nearest neighbor distances and deviant positioning within schools, which may increase their susceptibility to certain predators and have consequences for parasite transmission.
